intro: Tetrastigma bioritsense, commonly known as the climbing grapevine, is a woody vine belonging to the Vitaceae family. It is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by berries that range in color from green to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, humid environments. Tetrastigma bioritsense is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
